trans-unit.source: How to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Azure Active Directory authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your App Service application to use Azure Active Directory login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your App Service application to use Azure Active Directory login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Services to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure App Services to use Azure Active Directory as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This topic demonstrates use of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature.

trans-unit.source: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.
trans-unit.target: This replaces the App Service gateway for most applications.

trans-unit.source: If using the gateway, please see the [alternative method].
trans-unit.target: If using the gateway, please see the [alternative method].

trans-unit.source: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout that section.
trans-unit.target: Differences that apply to using the gateway are called out in notes throughout that section.

trans-unit.source: Configure Azure Active Directory using express settings
trans-unit.target: Configure Azure Active Directory using express settings

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication/Authorization**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication/Authorization**.

trans-unit.source: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.
trans-unit.target: If the Authentication / Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Azure Active Directory**, and then click **Express** under **Management Mode**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Azure Active Directory**, and then click **Express** under **Management Mode**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to register the application in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to register the application in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: This will create a new registration.
trans-unit.target: This will create a new registration.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to choose an existing registration instead, click **Select an existing app** and then search for the name of a previously created registration within your tenant.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to choose an existing registration instead, click **Select an existing app** and then search for the name of a previously created registration within your tenant.

trans-unit.source: Click the registration to select it and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click the registration to select it and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK** on the Azure Active Directory settings blade.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK** on the Azure Active Directory settings blade.

trans-unit.source: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.
trans-unit.target: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must authorize users in your app code.
trans-unit.target: You must authorize users in your app code.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Azure Active Directory, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Azure Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Azure Active Directory, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Azure Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Azure Active Directory for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Azure Active Directory for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: (Alternative method) Manually configure Azure Active Directory with advanced settings
trans-unit.target: (Alternative method) Manually configure Azure Active Directory with advanced settings

trans-unit.source: You can also choose to provide configuration settings manually.
trans-unit.target: You can also choose to provide configuration settings manually.

trans-unit.source: This is the preferred solution if the AAD tenant you wish to use is different from the tenant with which you sign into Azure.
trans-unit.target: This is the preferred solution if the AAD tenant you wish to use is different from the tenant with which you sign into Azure.

trans-unit.source: To complete the configuration, you must first create a registration in Azure Active Directory, and then you must provide some of the registration details to App Service.
trans-unit.target: To complete the configuration, you must first create a registration in Azure Active Directory, and then you must provide some of the registration details to App Service.

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure portal], and navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Copy your **URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy your **URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure your Azure Active Directory app.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure your Azure Active Directory app.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure classic portal] and navigate to **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure classic portal] and navigate to **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Select your directory, and then select the **Applications** tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Select your directory, and then select the **Applications** tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click **ADD** at the bottom to create a new app registration.
trans-unit.target: Click **ADD** at the bottom to create a new app registration.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add an application my organization is developing**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add an application my organization is developing**.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Web Application And/Or Web API** type.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Web Application And/Or Web API** type.

trans-unit.source: Then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: In the **SIGN-ON URL** box, paste the application URL you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: In the **SIGN-ON URL** box, paste the application URL you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: Enter that same URL in the **App ID URI** box.
trans-unit.target: Enter that same URL in the **App ID URI** box.

trans-unit.source: Then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: Once the application has been added, click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the application has been added, click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: Edit the **Reply URL** under **Single Sign-on** to be the the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/aad/callback_.
trans-unit.target: Edit the **Reply URL** under **Single Sign-on** to be the the URL of your application appended with the path, _/.auth/login/aad/callback_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/aad/callback`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/aad/callback`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your Reply URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-aad_ path.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the App Service Gateway instead of the App Service Authentication / Authorization feature, your Reply URL instead uses the gateway URL with the _/signin-aad_ path.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Then copy the **Client ID** for the app.
trans-unit.target: Then copy the **Client ID** for the app.

trans-unit.source: You will configure your application to use this later.
trans-unit.target: You will configure your application to use this later.

trans-unit.source: In the bottom command bar, click **View Endpoints**, and then copy the **Federation Metadata Document** URL and download that document or navigate to it in a browser.
trans-unit.target: In the bottom command bar, click **View Endpoints**, and then copy the **Federation Metadata Document** URL and download that document or navigate to it in a browser.

trans-unit.source: Within the root **EntityDescriptor** element, there should be an **entityID** attribute of the form `https://sts.windows.net/` followed by a GUID specific to your tenant (called a "tenant ID").
trans-unit.target: Within the root **EntityDescriptor** element, there should be an **entityID** attribute of the form `https://sts.windows.net/` followed by a GUID specific to your tenant (called a "tenant ID").

trans-unit.source: Copy this value - it will serve as your **Issuer URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy this value - it will serve as your **Issuer URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will configure your application to use this later.
trans-unit.target: You will configure your application to use this later.

trans-unit.source: Add Azure Active Directory information to your application
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Active Directory information to your application

trans-unit.source: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.
trans-unit.target: If using the App Service Gateway, ignore this section and instead navigate to your gateway in the portal.

trans-unit.source: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Azure Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Settings**, **Identity**, and then **Azure Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the ClientID and add the tenant ID to the **Allowed Tenants** list.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the ClientID and add the tenant ID to the **Allowed Tenants** list.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure portal], navigate to your application.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication/Authorization**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, and then **Authentication/Authorization**.

trans-unit.source: If the Authentication/Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.
trans-unit.target: If the Authentication/Authorization feature is not enabled, turn the switch to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Azure Active Directory**, and then click **Advanced** under **Management Mode**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Azure Active Directory**, and then click **Advanced** under **Management Mode**.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the Client ID and Issuer URL value which you obtained previously.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the Client ID and Issuer URL value which you obtained previously.

trans-unit.source: Then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.
trans-unit.target: By default, App Service provides authentication but does not restrict authorized access to your site content and APIs.

trans-unit.source: You must authorize users in your app code.
trans-unit.target: You must authorize users in your app code.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Azure Active Directory, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Azure Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) To restrict access to your site to only users authenticated by Azure Active Directory, set **Action to take when request is not authenticated** to **Azure Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Azure Active Directory for authentication.
trans-unit.target: This requires that all requests be authenticated, and all unauthenticated requests are redirected to Azure Active Directory for authentication.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Azure Active Directory for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Configure a native client application
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Configure a native client application

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory also allows you to register native clients, which provides greater control over permissions mapping.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory also allows you to register native clients, which provides greater control over permissions mapping.

trans-unit.source: You need this if you wish to perform logins using a library such as the **Active Directory Authentication Library**.
trans-unit.target: You need this if you wish to perform logins using a library such as the **Active Directory Authentication Library**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Active Directory** in the [Azure classic portal].
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Active Directory** in the [Azure classic portal].

trans-unit.source: Select your directory, and then select the **Applications** tab at the top.
trans-unit.target: Select your directory, and then select the **Applications** tab at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click **ADD** at the bottom to create a new app registration.
trans-unit.target: Click **ADD** at the bottom to create a new app registration.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add an application my organization is developing**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add an application my organization is developing**.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Native Client Application** type.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Application Wizard, enter a **Name** for your application and click the **Native Client Application** type.

trans-unit.source: Then click to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then click to continue.

trans-unit.source: In the **Redirect URI** box, enter your site's _/.auth/login/done_ endpoint, using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: In the **Redirect URI** box, enter your site's _/.auth/login/done_ endpoint, using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: This value should be similar to _https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/done_.
trans-unit.target: This value should be similar to _https://contoso.azurewebsites.net/.auth/login/done_.

trans-unit.source: Once the native application has been added, click the **Configure** tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the native application has been added, click the **Configure** tab.

trans-unit.source: Find the **Client ID** and make a note of this value.
trans-unit.target: Find the **Client ID** and make a note of this value.

trans-unit.source: Scroll the page down to the **Permissions to other applications** section and click **Add application**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll the page down to the **Permissions to other applications** section and click **Add application**.

trans-unit.source: Search for the web application that you registered earlier and click the plus icon.
trans-unit.target: Search for the web application that you registered earlier and click the plus icon.

trans-unit.source: Then click the check to close the dialog.
trans-unit.target: Then click the check to close the dialog.

trans-unit.source: On the new entry you just added, open the **Delegated Permissions** dropdown and select **Access (appName)**.
trans-unit.target: On the new entry you just added, open the **Delegated Permissions** dropdown and select **Access (appName)**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You have now configured a native client application which can access your App Service application.
trans-unit.target: You have now configured a native client application which can access your App Service application.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content
